class DailyNews_App.api_views.ArticleSubscriptionAPIView(**kwargs)

Bases: ListAPIView

API endpoint to list published articles specific to the authenticated client’s subscriptions (Journalists and Publishers).

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>, <class 'rest_framework.authentication.BasicAuthentication'>]
get_queryset()

Retrieves articles that match the authenticated user’s subscriptions. The authenticated user (request.user) acts as the third-party client account.

get_serializer_context()

Extra context provided to the serializer class.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
serializer_class

alias of ArticleSerializer

DailyNews_App.forms module

forms.py

This module contains the Django forms used for user input, validation, and data processing.

It includes:

  • Authentication Forms: Login and Registration.

  • Role-Specific Registration: handling distinct logic for Readers,

Journalists, and Editors. * Article Management: Forms for creating, editing, and updating article status.

class DailyNews_App.forms.ArticleForm(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: ModelForm

Form used by Journalists and Editors to create and edit articles.

Variables:

  • title – The headline of the article.

  • body – The main text content.

  • publisher – Dropdown to select which publisher this article belongs to.

  • featured_image – Optional cover image.

class DailyNews_App.forms.BaseUserRegistrationForm(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: UserCreationForm

Base registration form for all user roles.

Extends UserCreationForm to include email and profile photo fields, which are common across all roles (Reader, Journalist, Editor).

Variables:

  • email – Required email field.

  • profile_photo – Optional image upload field.

class DailyNews_App.forms.PublisherAffiliationForm(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: BaseUserRegistrationForm

A mixin/base form for staff roles (Journalist/Editor) that require Publisher affiliation.

Handles the input of ‘access passwords’ to link a new user to a Publisher organization.

Variables:

  • actualtoday_password – Password field for joining ‘ActualToday’.

  • sporttoday_password – Password field for joining ‘SportToday’.

base_fields = {'actualtoday_password': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'profile_photo': <django.forms.fields.ImageField object>, 'sporttoday_password': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'username': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
clean()

Custom validation logic to verify publisher passwords.

Process:

  1. Checks if at least one password field is filled.

2. Verifies the provided password against the stored Publisher record. 3. If valid, adds the Publisher object to cleaned_data['publishers_to_join'].

Returns:

The cleaned data dictionary.

Raises:

ValidationError – If no publisher is selected or if

passwords are incorrect.

declared_fields = {'actualtoday_password': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'profile_photo': <django.forms.fields.ImageField object>, 'sporttoday_password': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

DailyNews_App.models module

models.py

This module defines the database structure for the DailyNews application.

It includes models for:

  • User management with specific roles (Reader, Journalist, Editor).

  • Publisher organizations.

  • Article content management and workflow.

  • Subscription relationships between readers, publishers, and journalists.

class DailyNews_App.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Represents a news article within the application.

Variables:

  • title – The headline of the article.

  • body – The main content of the article.

  • creation_date – Automatically set when created.

  • last_edited_date – Automatically updated on save.

  • publication_date – Set automatically when status becomes ‘PUBLISHED’.

  • publisher – The Publisher organization this article belongs to.

  • author – The Journalist who wrote the article.

  • editor – The Editor who reviewed the article.

  • status – The current workflow state (Draft, Awaiting Review, Rejected, Published).

  • is_approved – Boolean flag, automatically True if status is Published.

  • featured_image – Main image for the article.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

STATUS_CHOICES = (('DRAFT', 'Draft'), ('AWAITING_REVIEW', 'Awaiting Editor Review'), ('REJECTED', 'Rejected'), ('PUBLISHED', 'Published'))
author

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

publisher

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

publisher_id
save(*args, **kwargs)

Overrides the default save method to handle automatic approval logic.

If the status is set to ‘PUBLISHED’, is_approved is set to True and publication_date is set to the current time (if not already set). Otherwise, is_approved is set to False.

Parameters:

  • args – Positional arguments passed to save.

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments passed to save.

status

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

title

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class DailyNews_App.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user model extending Django’s AbstractUser.

Includes role-based fields and subscription relationships.

Variables:

  • role – The user’s role in the system (Reader, Journalist, or Editor).

  • publisher_subscriptions – M2M relationship to Publishers a Reader follows.

  • journalist_subscriptions – M2M relationship to Journalists a Reader follows.

  • publishers – M2M relationship indicating which Publishers employ this user (for staff).

  • profile_photo – Optional profile image for the user.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

auth_token

Accessor to the related object on the reverse side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

followers

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

publishers

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

DailyNews_App.models.assign_user_to_group(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)

Signal receiver to automatically assign users to groups based on their selected role.

Triggered after a CustomUser is saved.

Parameters:

  • sender – The model class (CustomUser).

  • instance – The actual instance being saved.

  • created – Boolean, True if a new record was created.

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments.

DailyNews_App.serializers module

serializers.py

This module defines the Django REST Framework serializers for the DailyNews API.

It is responsible for transforming complex database models (Article, CustomUser, Publisher) into native Python datatypes (and eventually JSON) for API consumption.

Key Features:
  • Nested Serialization: Embedding Publisher and Author details

    directly within Article responses.

  • Dynamic Fields: Generating absolute URLs for articles based on the

    current request context.

  • Field Filtering: exposing only public-safe fields for

Users (Journalists).

class DailyNews_App.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: ModelSerializer

The primary serializer for the Article model.

It provides a complete representation of a news article, including full details of the Author and Publisher using nested serializers.

Variables:

  • author – Nested JournalistSerializer representation.

  • publisher – Nested PublisherSerializer representation.

  • article_url – Calculated field containing the full absolute URL to the article.

class Meta

Bases: object

fields = ('id', 'title', 'body', 'publication_date', 'author', 'publisher', 'article_url', 'featured_image')
model

alias of Article

read_only_fields = ('id', 'title', 'body', 'publication_date', 'author', 'publisher', 'article_url', 'featured_image')
get_article_url(obj)

Generates the absolute URL for the article reader view.

Uses the request context (if available) to build a full URI (including domain), otherwise falls back to a relative path.

Parameters:

obj – The Article instance being serialized.

Returns:

String URL

class DailyNews_App.serializers.JournalistSerializer(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializes the CustomUser model specifically for displaying Author details.

It filters out sensitive user information (like password, email, etc.) and includes the associated publishers.

Variables:

  • publishers – A list of nested PublisherSerializer objects.

  • profile_photo – URL to the user’s profile image.

class Meta

Bases: object

fields = ('id', 'username', 'first_name', 'last_name', 'publishers', 'profile_photo')
model

alias of CustomUser

class DailyNews_App.serializers.PublisherSerializer(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializes the Publisher model for API responses.

Typically used as a nested representation within ArticleSerializer.

Variables:

  • id – The database primary key.

  • name – The name of the publisher.

alias of Publisher

DailyNews_App.signals module

signals.py

This module contains Django signal receivers that handle automated background tasks.

Key features handled here:
  1. System Setup: Automatically creating User Groups and assigning

    Permissions after migration.

  2. User Onboarding: Assigning users to groups and generating API tokens

    upon registration.

  3. Content Distribution: Sending emails to subscribers and posting to

    social media (X/Twitter) when an article is published.

DailyNews_App.signals.assign_user_to_group(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)

Automatically assigns a new User to a Django Group based on their selected role.

Trigger: Runs after a User instance is created.

Parameters:

  • sender – The model class (CustomUser).

  • instance – The user instance.

  • created – Boolean, True if this is a new user.

DailyNews_App.signals.create_auth_token(sender, instance=None, created=False, **kwargs)

Generates a Django REST Framework (DRF) API Token for every new user.

Trigger: Runs after a User instance is created.

Parameters:

  • sender – The model class (CustomUser).

  • instance – The user instance.

  • created – Boolean, True if this is a new user.

DailyNews_App.signals.create_initial_groups(sender, apps, **kwargs)

Signal receiver that initializes the database with required User Groups and Permissions.

Trigger: Runs automatically after the migrate command is executed.

Actions:

  • Ensures required ‘ActualToday’ and ‘SportToday’ publishers exist.

  • Creates ‘Editor’, ‘Journalist’, and ‘Reader’ groups.

  • Assigns model-level permissions (add, change, delete, view) to

    these groups.

Parameters:

  • sender – The AppConfig that sent the signal.

  • apps – A registry of the installed applications.

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments.

DailyNews_App.signals.handle_article_publication_and_sharing(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)

Handles notifications and social media sharing when an Article is published.

Trigger: Runs after an Article instance is saved.

Logic:

  1. Checks if the article status is ‘PUBLISHED’.

  2. Email Notification: Aggregates emails of subscribers

    (to the Author or Publisher), removes duplicates, and sends a mass email.

  3. Social Media: Constructs a payload and sends a POST request to

    the X (Twitter) API if credentials are configured.

Parameters:

  • sender – The model class (Article).

  • instance – The actual Article instance being saved.

  • created – Boolean indicating if this is a new record.

DailyNews_App.tests module

class DailyNews_App.tests.ArticleSubscriptionAPITest(methodName='runTest')

Bases: APITestCase

Tests the ArticleSubscriptionAPIView endpoint to ensure correct subscription-based filtering and authentication.

setUp()

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_client_subscribes_to_both()

Client subscribes to J1 and P2 and should see articles from both.

test_client_subscribes_to_journalist_only()

Client subscribes to J1 and should see J1’s articles.

test_client_subscribes_to_publisher_only()

Client subscribes to P2 and should see all P2 articles.

test_only_published_articles_are_returned()

Ensure DRAFT articles are always excluded, regardless of subscription.

test_unauthenticated_access_is_denied()

Ensure requests without a token are rejected.

DailyNews_App.urls module

DailyNews_App.views module

views.py

This module handles the request-response cycle for the DailyNews Application.

It organizes views into logical sections:
  1. Authentication & Registration: Login, Logout, and generic

    registration handlers.

  2. Reader Views: Public feeds, article reading, and subscriptions.

  3. Journalist Views: Dashboard, article creation, and editing.

  4. Editor Views: Dashboard, article review, and publishing.

  5. Subscription Management: Logic for following publishers and

    journalists.

DailyNews_App.views.article_create_edit(request, pk=None)

Handles creation and editing of articles by Journalists.

Logic:

  • If pk is provided, edit the existing article (if owned by user).

  • If pk is None, create a new article.

  • Handles submission to a specific Publisher (Awaiting Review) or Independent Publishing.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk – (Optional) Primary Key of the article to edit.

Returns:

Rendered form or redirect to dashboard.

DailyNews_App.views.article_delete(request, pk)

Allows a Journalist or Editor to delete an article.

Permission Logic:

  • Must be the author of the article OR

  • Must be an Editor affiliated with the article’s publisher.

  • Article must NOT be in a finalized state (Published/Rejected)

if restricting logic applies.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary Key of the article to delete.

Returns:

Rendered confirmation page (GET) or redirect after deletion

(POST).

DailyNews_App.views.article_editor(request, pk)

Handles the review process for Editors.

Allows the editor to:

  1. Edit the content of a submitted article.

  2. Publish the article (approving it).

  3. Delete the article.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary Key of the article to review.

Returns:

Rendered ‘article_editor.html’ or redirect to dashboard.

DailyNews_App.views.article_journalist(request, pk)

Displays a detail view of an article specifically for the author (Journalist).

Includes the ability to delete the article via POST.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary Key of the article.

Returns:

Rendered ‘article_journalist.html’.

DailyNews_App.views.article_list(request)

Displays a global list of all published articles.

Calculates subscription status for logged-in users to toggle UI buttons (Subscribe/Unsubscribe) efficiently.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered ‘article_list.html’ with article data context.

DailyNews_App.views.article_reader(request, pk)

Displays a single article detail view for a Reader.

Enforces that the article must be ‘PUBLISHED’ unless the user is staff. Also displays ‘More from this author’.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary Key of the article.

Returns:

Rendered ‘article_reader.html’.

Editor manages.

Rendered ‘editor_home.html’.

DailyNews_App.views.login_view(request)

Handles user login and redirects based on role or ‘next’ URL.

If a ‘next’ parameter is present in the POST request, the user is

redirected there.

Otherwise, they are redirected to their role-specific dashboard.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered login page or redirect to home.

DailyNews_App.views.logout_view(request)

Logs out the current user and redirects to the login page.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

DailyNews_App.views.manage_subscriptions_view(request)

Placeholder view for the subscription management page. This view must be created to resolve the NoReverseMatch error.

DailyNews_App.views.reader_home(request)

Displays the personalized news feed for a Reader.

Aggregates articles from:

  1. Subscribed Journalists.

  2. Subscribed Publishers.

  3. A general feed of all published articles (excluding duplicates).

Also provides sidebar data for current subscriptions.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered ‘reader_home.html’.

DailyNews_App.views.register_editor(request)

Handles the registration of a new Editor user using the generic handler.

DailyNews_App.views.register_journalist(request)

DailyNews_App.views.register_select_role(request)

Initial registration view to select user role.

DailyNews_App.views.register_user(request, role_name, form_class, template_name, redirect_name)

Generic helper view to handle registration for different user roles.

Processes the form, assigns the role, handles implicit publisher affiliation (for Editors), logs the user in, and redirects to their specific home page.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • role_name – String role (‘READER’, ‘JOURNALIST’, ‘EDITOR’).

  • form_class – The Django form class to use for validation.

  • template_name – The name of the template to render.

  • redirect_name – The URL name to redirect to upon success.

Returns:

Rendered template or redirect.

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk – The ID of the Journalist.

Returns:

Redirect to the previous page.

Handles POST requests to subscribe/unsubscribe to journalists or publishers.

Redirects back to ‘article_list’.
